title: Devon wardrobe vs front pop out window catch

posts.content:
I seem to remember seeing that front pop out catches impinge on Devon wardrobes?

Is there any way around this? How much does it catch by, could a modified catch be made? Is it different for early spoons vs late catches?

My alternatives are:

a. to fit the pop outs opening 'forwards'
- but I like the one I can reach from behind my head when I'm driving
- and I might catch my clothes on the catch when getting out of the cargo door
- and it might look a bit odd, although Sooty did this on his samba and it looked awesome

b. to fit a 'fixed' pop out frame on the left hand side
- it will be visually inkeeping with the other five
- I will probably need to make some sort of catch to keep it closed but without hitting the wardrobe

c. fit four fixed windows and two rear pop outs as per factory
- but I like the front ones for getting enough breeze through on a summer's day

mmm
Thought provoking..
USA buses had them opening at the front for the ram effect....... Off to look on thesamba.com..
G
the wardrobe only goes just over 1/3 of the way up the windowâ€¦I 'think' the catch would clear it

On the photos I've studied, the aluminium trim of the wardrobe looks like it sits just below half way - maybe a cm, maybe an inch - which would either just clear or just hit a window catch.

The Devon sambas I've studied have fixed side glass except for the two rear pop outs as per a non-deluxe microbus setup.

So I'm not sure.

Any photos or ideas for what others have done would be great.

Yes perfect thank you.

So it doesn't clear the wardrobe vertically but looks like a small 62-onwards catch fits laterally to the wardrobe.

I have small catches, medium spoons and long spoons to play with so will be able to see what fits once I've rebuilt it. But at least I know something fits so I can leave the hinge in place before painting.

Very helpful thank you
